program.name: Health Benefits for Workers with Disabilities (HBWD)
program.description: HBWD is a Medicaid buy-in program that provides health coverage to working individuals with disabilities. This program helps people with disabilities maintain their Medicaid coverage while they work and earn income. Eligibility includes age requirements, disability status, employment, income limits, and asset limits.
program.website_description: Health coverage for working individuals with disabilities

documents.text: Proof of identity - name and date of birth verification (ex: driver's license, state ID, birth certificate)
Proof of disability (ex: Social Security disability determination, medical documentation)
Proof of employment (ex: pay stubs, letter from employer, self-employment records)
Proof of income (ex: pay stubs, tax returns, benefit statements showing all earned and unearned income)
Proof of assets (ex: bank statements, investment statements, vehicle registration)
Proof of Illinois residency (ex: driver's license, utility bill, or mail with your name and address)

navigators.name: Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services
navigators.description: For questions about HBWD eligibility and application process, contact the Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services
